translations.chinese: 項伯亦起舞，常以身翼蔽沛公。
translations.english: Xiang Bo also rose to dance, constantly using his body to shield Pei Gong.
Fan Kuai heard the situation was urgent and charged straight in, extremely angry.
Xiang Yu admired his bravery and gave him wine.
Fan Kuai took advantage to rebuke Xiang Yu.

translations.chinese: 有頃，沛公起如廁，招樊噲出，置車官 屬，獨騎，與樊噲、靳彊、滕公、紀成步，從間道走軍，使張良留謝羽。
translations.english: After a while, Pei Gong rose as if to use the toilet and beckoned Fan Kuai to come out. He placed his chariot officials and retainers, rode alone with Fan Kuai, Jin Qiang, Lord Teng, and Ji Cheng on foot, escaping the army by a side road, leaving Zhang Liang to stay and apologize to Xiang Yu.
